data.title: Fixed long server names being sanitized
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8448.

data.title: SanitizedName on Servername is a bit harsh?
data.body:
I saw that the new name sanitizer puts a max length on 16, this is not limited to player names only, also server hostnames, is this intentional?

Hopefully I'd be able to have a bit longer hostnames than 16 :)

data.title: Offset the TS shroud sequences.
data.body:
For some reason WW thought it was a good idea to offset the shroud/fog sprites by 1px vertically relative to the terrain tiles (see screenshot).  This applies the opposite offset in our sequences to line them up again.  The easiest way to test this is to look at the edges of the map in #8430.

![offset](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/8046431/bcfc02f4-0e32-11e5-966a-16f4f0a42886.png)

data.title: Harvester logic makes this mission unplayable, AI can't harvest.
data.body:
Ok, so this is making my conversion undoable. Technically, I could make little trace of ore to the base so it would be closer than the ore on the island, but this is just hiding the problem and it looks damn stupid. Also, if a new harv is produced, it gets stuck right away. And there could be other missions with even worse scenarios. So the harvester logic needs to be adapted to deal with this/new command has to be made to force the AI harvester to mine from a specific field. :)

![bez nazvu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/8045272/6bd2557c-0e32-11e5-8f8f-00feafbf6e76.png)

data.title: Package the *.exe.config files on all platforms
data.body:
I just noticed that the packaging of the .exe.config files was inconsistent.

Windows and Mac OS X only shipped the Game.exe.config, not the Utility.exe.config.
Debian shipped neither.

The Game.exe.config is currently only used on Windows, while the Utility.exe.config is only used on systems using mono.

I opted to ship all .configs on all platforms. If someday someone decides to add something to those files, it would just be forgotten to add them to the packages.

data.title: Elite weapon(s) in TS broken
data.body:
I don't know yet whether this is a yaml or code issue, but in any case elite weapons don't work.

The Nod bike should get the HoverMissile @ elite, but it doesn't.

data.title: Adds a chat logging feature.
data.body:
Ingame chat is logged in chat.log file with the following format:
10:50:42 <Server> hello has joined the game.
10:51:01 <hello> hello.

Fixes #8136.

data.title: Expanded the bug reporting guidelines
data.body: A humble wish.

data.title: WithBarrel appears to be broken
data.body:
...Since at least 5 months.

I guess this can happen if a trait is rarely ever used.

As testcase, add

``` yaml
WithBarrel:
          Barrel: leftarm
          Sequence: turret
          LocalOffset: 0,-768,0
```

to RA's cruiser (CA). 
With release 20141029 it will show a 3rd turret via `WithBarrel`, with anything from this year it crashes:

```

Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209

   bei OpenRA.World.CreateActor(String name, TypeDictionary initDict) in e:\OpenRA_work2\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Zeile 229.
```

data.title: Investigate replacing current lua sandbox by modifying Eluant.
data.body:
Currently we sandbox dangerous lua functions using a lua sandboxing script. This causes issues when you get an error between the Lua binding and CLR, where it shows the line that errored as being a line in the sandbox script. This also causes issues if a programmer would like to use a safe function or table by completely removing the ability to access certain tables. (!)

With Eluant, we should be able to completely disable dangerous code evaluation in the implementation of Lua by:
Disabling bytecode or, if that is not possible, removing eval.
Removing potentially dangerous functions/modules.

This will improve our errors and decrease the overhead in executing lua scripts.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/20850683-investigate-replacing-current-lua-sandbox-by-modifying-eluant?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Choose starting sound by type of Map
data.body:
i noticed on our official shellmap, that the music begins to play right after game start.
when i save my map as shellmap and she gets loaded after game start only an "battlefield control..." sound is played.

an idea would be to select the sound by the type of the map
- shellmap = main menu music / scripted sound
- regulary = battlefield control...

data.title: [Map Editor] One Click Forest painting
data.body:
In Finalsun it was able to paint a forest with trees. it switches the trees when they  are placed. we could also implementig such thing.

the Creater cklics a button "paint forest" and the Editor selects 4 random trees and paint a forest with these selected trees on the map. instead of selecting every tree as its own :(

data.title: Added ReShaper dupFinder scans
data.body: ~~Just playing around with https://confluence.jetbrains.com/display/NETCOM/Introducing+ReSharper+Command+Line+Tools. Not meant to be actually merged (yet).~~

data.title: Using alternate palettes for actor icons.
data.body:
There is a hard-coded chrome palette that runs the icons.

When using assets between mods, there is no current method to override this and read from another palette to keep the correct color.

Use a trait inside Buildable: for each item that will need the effect?

data.title: Added the namespace headers to the trait documentation table of contents
data.body: I forgot to add the namespace separators to the table of contents of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits-(playtest) which makes it less useful. A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8078.

data.title: Add WPos shroud visibility queries.
data.body: Another small step towards heightmap-aware shroud, which can return different results depending on where inside a cell you query.

data.title: A few minor portability fixes
data.body:
An attempt to eliminate some local changes in FreeBSD port. Unix desktop includes the following systems. Adding ifdefs for them all is kinda overkill, so let's simplify instead.
- Linux except Android
- Bitrig, DragonFly, FreeBSD, MirBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD
- Solaris-based systems
- GNU/kFreeBSD
- GNU/Hurd (not sure if it can do OpenGL 2.0)

Tested with `gmake dependencies` and

``` diff
Index: games/openra/Makefile
===================================================================
--- games/openra/Makefile   (revision 387370)
+++ games/openra/Makefile   (working copy)
@@ -82,10 +82,8 @@ post-patch:
        ${MV} -v ${WRKDIR}/$${f#*/} ${WRKSRC}/thirdparty; \
    done

-   ${REINPLACE_CMD} -e 's/Linux/${OPSYS}/' \
-       -e '/CP_R/s,hicolor/,hicolor,' \
+   ${REINPLACE_CMD} \
        -e '/fetch-thirdparty-deps/d' \
-       -e 's/crashdialog/gamemonitor/' \
        -e '/echo/!s/   @/  /' \
        -e '/^mods:/s/$$/ version/' \
        -e '/^docs:/s/$$/ all/' \
@@ -96,9 +94,6 @@ post-patch:
    ${SED} 's/@LIBLUA51@/liblua-${LUA_VER}.so/' \
        ${WRKSRC}/thirdparty/Eluant.dll.config.in \
        >${WRKSRC}/Eluant.dll.config
-# DragonFly lacks BSD suffix
-   ${REINPLACE_CMD} -e 's/"BSD"/"${OPSYS}"/' \
-       ${WRKSRC}/OpenRA.Game/Platform.cs

 post-build:
 .if ${PORT_OPTIONS:MDOCS}
```

data.title: Display and support editing the area outside the map bounds
data.body:
Fixes one of the few limitations that the new editor has vs the old.  Also fixes the missing tiles that used to appear at the right/bottom edges of the screen in TS (I was sure we had a ticket on this, but can't find it).

Depends on #8337.

data.title: Configure dl agent
data.body:
`curl(1)` is not available in a base FreeBSD install. As it has a counterpart (`fetch(1)`), we use it if curl is not available.

Tested and fully functionnal on FreeBSD 10.1

data.title: thirdparty/fetch-thirdparty-deps.sh: silence the nuget check
data.body: The check was printing lots of errors on archlinux: I silenced it.

data.title: thirdparty/*.sh: add comments on POSIX-compliant scripts
Fixed missing ships when importing legacy RA maps
Fixed a bad choice of lock objects in ColorMixerWidget
data.body: ~~Reverts https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3727 and~~ fixes it properly. Detected as a high impact outstanding issue by Coverity due to nondeterministic locking behavior.

data.title: openra: introduce a FreeBSD rc.d script
data.body: Requires screen

data.title: Fixed a NullReferenceException in Sync.HashTarget
data.body: `FrozenActor.Actor` can be null when the actor `IsDead`. Detected by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed a division through zero in PerfItem.Average
data.body: Detected using Coverity.

data.title: Fixed a bad bit shift operation in PriorityQueue
data.body:
`--level` can be -1 here. This leads to undefined behavior. https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/f96c63ed.aspx

Discovered using Coverity.

data.title: Fixed a dereference after null check in UnitOrderGenerator.CheckSameOrder
data.body: Discovered by Coverity.
